title: Schur’s Lemma
text:
We begin with a fundamental result in representation theory.

Theorem 1 (Schur’s Lemma) Let \(V\) and \(W\) be irreducible representations of a group \(G\). If \(\phi: V \to W\) is a \(G\)-module homomorphism, then:

Either \(\phi\) is an isomorphism, or \(\phi = 0\).
If \(V = W\), then \(\phi = \lambda I\) for some \(\lambda \in \C\).
